IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: 23-MSP-042090 32600 Main Street, Queen Anne, Talbot County, MD 21657 TROOPER T. BENSON #7099 MARYLAND STATE POLICE - EASTON BARRACK Maryland State Police (MSP) Axon Body Worn Camera operational. Incident recorded. Suspect(s): Unknown Victim(s): Name: Milton Leo Barth Jr. Date of Birth: 05/01/1961 MD SDX: B-630-603-507-334 Address: 216 Maple Avenue, Federalsburg, Caroline County, MD 21632 Scene Processing: Photographs Stolen Property: Catalytic Converter from black 2003 Ford F-250 (VIN: 1FTNX21L43EB21448) Narrative: On Tuesday, November 28, 2023, at approximately 1038 hours, I, TFC. Benson #7099, was dispatched to 32600 Main Street, Queen Anne, Talbot County, MD 21657 for the report of the theft of a catalytic converter. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the complainant, identified as Milton Leo Barth Jr., DOB: 05/01/1961, 2/M. Barth stated that his black 2003 Ford F-250 (VIN: 1FTNX21L43EB21448) has been at Daves Riverside Garage, located at 32600 Main Street, Queen Anne, Talbot County, MD 21657, for several months for maintenance work. Barth stated his truck has been at the garage for between five (5) and six (6) months getting maintenance work as they were having trouble getting the truck to run properly. Barth stated he last checked on the truck, in person, approximately six (6) weeks prior and did not notice anything out of the ordinary. Barth stated he stopped at Daves Riverside Garage to get an update on his vehicle the morning on November 28, 2023 when he noticed the running board was missing from the brackets on the driver side of the vehicle. Upon further inspection he observed the rear exhaust pointing up towards the bed of the truck. Barth stated he looked underneath the truck and observed the catalytic converter had been cut out and removed from underneath the truck. Barth stated he made contact with Daves Riverside Garage and informed them of the situation. Barth informed me that Daves Riverside Garage has one (1) CCTV Surveillance Camera on the west side of the building pointing in the direction of his truck, but the truck is too far away from the camera and out of the cameras sight picture. Barth was provided a Victim Witness Pamphlet with a case number for his Insurance Company and asked to provided any updated information in the future. Photographs of the scene were taken and have been uploaded to this report. A check of the surrounding area did not locate any additional CCTV Surveillance Cameras that would have captured the incident. I made contact with the employees of Daves Riverside Garage who stated they have not observed any suspicious activity around the property in the last several weeks. They did state that they have had catalytic converter thefts in the past, but often dont report them due to the nature of the theft. They stated they often just replace the catalytic converter and do not report the theft because the part has more than likely already been scrapped. Employees confirmed the CCTV Surveillance camera on the west side of the building is operational but does not capture the area where the truck was parked. It should be noted that the truck was parked on the western most part of the property closest to Sewell Street. I cleared without further incident. I REQUEST THIS CASE SUSPENDED DUE TO THE TIMELINE AND LACK OF INVESTIGATIVE LEADS. ALL EVENTS OCCURRED IN TALBOT COUNTY, MD.
